episode_title: 811 - The One With Ross’ Big Step Forward

content.description: Central Perk, Rachel is looking around the shop as Phoebe returns from getting some more coffee.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Phoebe?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Look at that guy by the window, wow!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: He’s awfully short and I think he’s talking to himself. And to be completely honest, he’s not that good in bed.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, what is wrong with me lately? I mean it’s like every guy I see—I mean look here. (Points behind them) Look at that guy for example, I mean normally that’s not someone I would-would be attracted too, but right now, with the way I’m feeling, all I want to do is rip off his sweatpants and fanny pack.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wait a second! This is about the forth month of your pregnancy right?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: This is completely normal, around the forth month your hormones start going crazy.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Really?! So this has happened to you?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh absolutely yeah! Oh and keep in mind now, I was carrying triplets so in, y’know, medical terms I was-I was thrice as randy.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wow! This explains so much! Last weekend, I went from store to store sitting on Santa’s lap.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah. Yeah, I remember trying to steal a cardboard cutout of Evander Holyfield from a Foot Locker .

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ah.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, y’know what? I go see my doctor tomorrow I’ll ask her about this. Maybe she can give me a pill or something.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah. Yeah, that’s what you need a good…pill.

content.description: Central Perk, Joey and Ross are there as Mona enters.

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Hey! (To Joey) Hey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Hi! Look! I got our pictures developed from Rockefeller Center.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh great! Hey-hey Joey, do you want to check out pictures of me and Mona ice skating?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh uh, ordinarily I would love too, but I am just swamped right now. (Brushes something off of his shirt and looks around, but doesn’t move from his chair.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey where-where are the pictures that creepy pretzel vendor took of us together?

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Oh yeah, probably at the end. (Flips to the end.) Oh my God! He only took pictures of my breasts!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m missin’ picture time?! (Jumps over to look, Ross glares at him and he retreats.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Y’know she has a face Ross!

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Okay. Okay, here’s a good one of us.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wow! That is a good one! Wow, it looks like a, like a holiday card y’know, with the tree in the middle and the skaters and the snow.

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Y’know, every year I say I’m gonna send out holiday cards and I never do it. Do you wanna, do you wanna send this one out together?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Together? Like-like to people?

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Yeah, y’know. Happy holidays from Mona and Ross. It’ll be cute, okay?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay. (Not happy about it.)

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Oh, I gotta get to work. So call me later?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh sure, sure.

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Bye guys.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Bye.
(Mona exits.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Congratulations! You just got married!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I know. Can you believe that?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wait, I’m-I’m sorry. What’s the big deal about a holiday card?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Married couples send out cards, families send out cards, people who have been dating for a couple of months do not send out cards! What-what is she crazy?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey-hey-hey, hey that’s your wife you’re talking about!

content.description: Chandler’s Office, his boss Doug is entering Monica is there as well.

content.speaker: Doug
content.text: Bing! Ho! And the Bing-ette!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Honey, you remember my boss Doug right?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes, hi.

content.speaker: Doug
content.text: Hi. So good news, the divorce is final. I signed the papers this A.M.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I didn’t know you and Carol were getting divorced, I’m sorry.

content.speaker: Doug
content.text: Sorry? Finally chewed my leg out of that bear trap. Hey, congratulations to you guys though!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No leg chewing for us sir.

content.speaker: Doug
content.text: Oh well, give it time. So the divorce, the marriage, we’ve got a lot to celebrate. How about we all go out to dinner tomorrow night?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I can’t think of anything we’re doing. (Quietly) Why can’t I think of anything we’re doing?

content.speaker: Doug
content.text: Tomorrow night it is then, I should be out of court by six. They keep throwing these sexual harassment cases at me and I keep knocking them out of the park!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, I’ll see you tomorrow! (Doug exits.) Just so you know, we’re not seeing him tomorrow. (Chandler wonders why.) I-I cannot spend another evening with that man. Do you remember how he behaved at our wedding?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s because he wasn’t invited because of the way he behaved at our engagement party.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh yeah. Boy, urine cuts right through an ice sculpture doesn’t it?

content.description: Ross’s Apartment, there’s a knock on the door and he opens it to Mona.

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Hey, I went by the photo shop, take a look, here is a mockup of our card. What do you think?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Huh. Wow, this is great.

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Now, do you think it should say, “Love Ross and Mona?”

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, we-we haven’t said that to each other yet, but I guess its okay to say it to other people.

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: How many did you want? I’m getting a hundred.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: A hundred?! Well, I-I guess I’ll take a—Mona, uh…I-I’m not sure about the whole uh, card thing.

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Really? Why not?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Sending out a holiday card, together, I mean I just don’t know if we’re really quite there yet.

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Oh y’know, I didn’t think of it that way. You’re right. You’re right. So, can I ask you a question?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Where are we?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Huh.

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Y’know, like where are we? Where is this relationship going?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hmm…

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: I mean I love spending time with you, y’know I just—I hope we’re moving forward. I mean, we should probably talk about that. Don’t you think?
(Pause.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Let’s do the card!

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: The card! I think we’re there!

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Okay. I—But I think we should still have this conversation.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Really?! I mean, even with the card?

content.description: Rachel’s Doctor’s Office, she is waiting for her doctor as a nurse enters.

content.speaker: Nurse
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Nurse
content.text: Just so you know, Dr. Long can’t be here today, she was called to the hospital, so Dr. Schiff will be seeing you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, okay. Hey, can I ask you a question? Was it me, or-or was the guy who took my blood sample really cute? Y’know who I’m talking about, bald haircut, hairy fingers… (Stops when she realizes it was her.)

content.speaker: Dr. Schiff
content.text: Hi Rachel? I’m Dr. Schiff. (By the way, he’s an attractive man.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes, you are.

content.speaker: Dr. Schiff
content.text: So, how’s it going?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, really, really good. But enough about me, come on! Where-where are you from? What do you do?

content.speaker: Dr. Schiff
content.text: I’m a doctor.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Right! Right! I-I actually meant in your spare time, do you cook? Do you ski? Or do you just hang out with your wife or girlfriend?

content.speaker: Dr. Schiff
content.text: Uh, I don’t have a wife or girlfriend, but I do like to ski.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, I love to ski! How amazing is this?!

content.speaker: Dr. Schiff
content.text: So, are you experiencing any discomfort?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No. I’m very comfortable.

content.speaker: Dr. Schiff
content.text: Any painful gas?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No! Shoot, Dr. Schiff what kind of question is that?!

content.speaker: Dr. Schiff
content.text: Okay then, would you like to lie down on the table?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well would you like me to lie down on the table?

content.speaker: Dr. Schiff
content.text: I’m sorry, is there something going on here?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Do you feel it too?

content.description: Central Perk, Monica and Phoebe are there as Rachel enters.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh hey! So, how did your doctor’s appointment go?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, let’s see. Uh, they gave me cute doctor today and in the middle of the exam I put my pinky in his chin dimple.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why did you do that?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, remember that little problem I was having during my forth month of pregnancy?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh yeah, the Evander Holyfield phase. Oh man you were so hard up you practically came on to me.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You wish.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, I could’ve had you if I wanted you.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh yeah? Come and get it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, even this is turning me on!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh hey! Hey Ross! Hey how’s it, how’s it going with you and Mona? Are you guys still together?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh yeah, yeah we’re moving forward. You’ll be getting our card!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You and Mona are doing a holiday card together?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, we’re not just doing a card! Y’know, she-she also wants to have the conversation about where the relationship is going.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ugh! Women!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I know! I know! Why do you guys need to have this conversation?! Huh? I mean no self-respecting man would ask a woman, “So, where is this going?”

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh Ross? You asked me that.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey! You were a closed book! Okay? I’m not a mind reader! Besides, I hate those conversations. I’m horrible at them. Really! Maybe-maybe I need kind of a gesture. Y’know, something that says we’re moving forward without having to talk about it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Like asking her to move in with you?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Smaller than that.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Making her a mixed tape?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh, bigger than that.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Give her a key to your apartment.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Whoa-hello! We were closer with the mixed tape.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right. Have you said, “I love you?” You could say, I love you.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah I-I don’t-I don’t think I’m quite there yet, but I could say I looove spending time with you.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, we hate that.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That is a slap in the face.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Forget it. I-I—Y’know what? I’ll just have the conversation. I’ll just say I like things the way they are, and hope for the best. What do you think Rach?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I think, if it was a little colder in here I could see your nipples through that sweater.

content.speaker: Doug
content.text: Bing! We’re all set for tonight, 8 o’clock.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh uh, as it turns out, we can’t do it. Monica has to work.

content.speaker: Doug
content.text: Oh, my ex-wife didn’t work, unless you call turning into her mother work. Fine. Tomorrow night then.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh uh well tomorrow’s no good for her either.

content.speaker: Doug
content.text: Oh? Why not?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It’s the semi-finals…of her…botchy ball tournament.

content.speaker: Doug
content.text: What’s going on Bing? Does uh, your wife have a problem with me or something?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well now-now you’re just talking crazy.

content.speaker: Doug
content.text: So why can’t the three of us go out together?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Because uh…we-we…we split up. Monica and I split up. Hold me.

content.speaker: Doug
content.text: Good God Bing I…well I can’t say I’m altogether surprised, I saw the way she looked at you, and there was no love there. And the way she looked at me, pure lust.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know what would really help me through this tough time is choking something. Can I choke ya?

content.speaker: Doug
content.text: Bing my boy, we’re gonna get you over this. Now here’s the plan, grab your coat, we’re going to a strip club.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh no-no-no, Monica would freak. (Doug looks at him.) But to hell with that bitch.

content.description: Central Perk, Ross is getting Mona some coffee.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Here we go. Mona umm, I think it’s time we-we had a conversation about-about where things are with us.

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Yeah, I-I think I suggested that.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Aw, we-we are so…(Motions that they’re connected.) So umm, well I-I-I like you and I-I love umm, y’know hanging out with you. And I mean-I’m having a lot of fun. (He pauses and thinks there might but more, but decides there isn’t.)

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I mean, there’s no point in spending time with someone if-if it’s just fun. It’s gotta be, it’s gotta be going somewhere right? So where-where is it going? (Pause) Ah! That’s-that’s the real question. And-and the answer is…is it’s going somewhere…fun. Now I-I know what you’re thinking, fun was fine for you like ten years ago y’know, but you’re-you’re not getting any younger. No I mean—No not you, not you, you—you are getting younger. I mean—you-you look like you’re getting younger by the second—What’s your secret?

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: I’m sorry, so umm, so where are we?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, well to sum up, we’re having fun, you look young.

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Okay…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: But that’s not enough. So… So…here’s a key to my apartment. (Hands her his key.)

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Really?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Really.

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: You don’t think this is too fast.
(Ross groans no.)

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s, Ross is telling Rachel and Monica about yet another mistake he’s made with a woman.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You gave her a key to your apartment?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Not just a key, I gave her the only key! I am now a homeless person in a very serious relationship.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey. Ooh Ross! How’d the conversation go?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh great, I live on the street.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Where?! (Ross exits.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hi! Okay, Monica, Rachel, this is my friend Roger.

content.speaker: Roger
content.text: Hey everybody.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi Roger.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So umm, I’m gonna get us some drinks. (To Rachel) Would you help me out?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah. (They go into the kitchen.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Umm, he’s here to have sex with you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You’re welcome.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Phoebe no!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It’s okay, he’s a virgin.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Rachel umm, I was just talking to this guy and I think he’ll have sex with you.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, okay let’s leave these two alone.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No! I do not care what my hormones are doing, I am not going to just do it with some random guy!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Fine! Then you tell Roger because he was really looking forward to this! (Phoebe exits.)

content.description: A Strip Club, Doug and Chandler are there.

content.speaker: Doug
content.text: Oh Bing, look at those twin sisters dancing together. Let me buy you a lap dance with those girls. Huh?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh that’s all right sir, and that’s just one girl.

content.speaker: Doug
content.text: Bing—What’s this?! (Grabs his hand.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It’s a hand. It’s a thing you use as a Jack and Coke holder.

content.speaker: Doug
content.text: No, it’s a wedding ring. You gotta get rid of it. We’re gonna go to the East River right now and throw it in there!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh no-no-no!

content.speaker: Doug
content.text: Oh yeah-yeah-yeah, y’know I did it and I felt a hell of a lot better and if you whip it just right you might hit a seagull in the head.

content.description: Ross’s Apartment, a locksmith has finished changing the locks on Ross’s door.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, and oh I’m gonna need a bunch of extra keys. Apparently I give them away for no reason at all.

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Hey Ross, what’s going on? You changing the lock?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No. That guy is.

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: I don’t understand. You-you give me a key to your apartment and then you change the lock.

content.speaker: Locksmith
content.text: Good luck buddy. (Exits.)

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Umm, I-I thought we were moving forward and now you’re-you’re sending me all these mixed signals. What are you trying to tell me?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m trying to tell you I made you a mix tape.

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I love you!

content.speaker: Mona
content.text: Ohh! (Hugs him.) And I love spending time with you. (Ross isn’t happy.)

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Monica is eating dinner as Chandler enters.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hi honey I’m home.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: From the tequila factory?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It was awful. To get out of going to dinner with Doug I told him that you and I split up. So then he took me to all these strip clubs and sleazy bars, and then when I wouldn’t give him my wedding ring, he threw a soda can at a bird!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Come here. I can breath throw my mouth.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know what the worse part was? I got to see what my life would be like without you. It was like It’s a Wonderful Life with lap dances. Please promise that you will never leave me, that we will grow old together, and be with each other for the rest of our lives.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I promise. Hey, speaking of together, how about we send out a holiday card this year?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ooh, I don’t know if we’re there yet.

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s, Rachel is on the phone.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes. Hi, I’d like to order a pizza. Okay, can I ask you a question? Is-is the cute blond guy delivering tonight? Very Ambocrombie & Fitch . (Joey enters.) I’ll call you back.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Who was that?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: It’s just the pizza place.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You hung up on the pizza place? I don’t hang up on your friends.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m sorry honey, I’m just having a, having a rough day.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, what’s wrong?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh you really, you really just don’t want to hear about it.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Then why did I ask?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, it’s just—and this is really embarrassing—but lately with this whole pregnancy thing I’m just finding myself…how do I put this umm, erotically charged.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Is that college talk for horny?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah. So y’know, I have all of these feelings and I don’t know what to do about them, because I can’t date like a normal person, which is fine because I don’t need a relationship, I mean all I really want is one great night. Just sex, y’know? No strings attached, no relationship, just with someone that I feel comfortable with and who knows what he’s doing. For just one great night, I mean is that really so…hard…to find. (Looks at Joey.) So how was your day?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Good, I uh, I saw a pretty big pigeon.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, I gotta get up early and it’s almost seven o’clock.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, I gotta, I gotta go to my room to.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, good night!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Good night. (They both enter their rooms.)
(Pause.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I can’t do it!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I didn’t ask you to do it!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You’re Rachel!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You’re Joey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You’re my friend!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Right back at ya!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: But plus it would be wrong and weird and-and-and bad.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And so bad. I don’t even know what you’re talking about because I didn’t ask you to do anything!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I know!
(Pause.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Do you wanna do it?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, me neither! I was just testing you!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That’s the end of this conversation!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: This conversation never happened!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Never happened! Good night!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Good night!
(They both go into their rooms and after a little while Rachel pokes her head into the living room.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Get back in there! (Rachel re-enters her room and closes the door.)

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s, Rachel is there as Phoebe enters.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hi. Listen, I’m sorry about that whole thing with Roger. It really wasn’t right, and I, and I want to make it up to you, so umm, I brought you something that I think you’ll really enjoy. (Goes into the hallway and returns carrying the Evander Holyfield cutout.) Now, this is just a loan. Okay? I’m gonna, I’m gonna want him back. So… (Looks at him longingly) I’m gonna go now. (Exits.) (Pause) (Entering) I’m sorry, I thought I could do it and I can’t! (She grabs the cutout and exits for good.)
